content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements, if true, would guarantee that there is a number <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f of c, equals 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 5, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 4, equals 20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 5, equals 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 4, equals 30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 5, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 4, equals 20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 5, equals 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 4, equals 30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 5, comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 5, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 4, equals 20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
